intro: Sebastiania schottiana, commonly known as the red-sepal sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its striking red sepals and yellow-orange flowers, which are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Sebastiania schottiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
